verses.verse: And Jacob<WH3290> went<WH1980> on his way,<WH1870> and the angels<WH4397> of God<WH430> met<WH6293> him.
And when<WH834> Jacob<WH3290> saw<WH7200> them, he said,<WH559> This<WH2088> is God's<WH430> host:<WH4264> and he called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of that place<WH4725> Mahanaim.<WH4266>
And Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> before<WH6440> him to Esau<WH6215> his brother<WH251> to the land<WH776> of Seir,<WH8165> the country<WH7704> of Edom.<WH123>

And he commanded<WH6680> them, saying,<WH559> Thus<WH3541> shall you speak<WH559> to my lord<WH113> Esau;<WH6215> Your servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> thus,<WH3541> I have sojourned<WH1481> with Laban,<WH3837> and stayed<WH309> there until<WH5704> now:<WH6258>

And I have<WH1961> oxen,<WH7794> and asses,<WH2543> flocks,<WH6629> and menservants,<WH5650> and womenservants:<WH8198> and I have sent<WH7971> to tell<WH5046> my lord,<WH113> that I may find<WH4672> grace<WH2580> in your sight.<WH5869>

And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725> to Jacob,<WH3290> saying,<WH559> We came<WH935> to your brother<WH251> Esau,<WH6215> and also<WH1571> he comes<WH1980> to meet<WH7125> you, and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> with him.

Then Jacob<WH3290> was greatly<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> and distressed:<WH3334> and he divided<WH2673> the people<WH5971> that was with him, and the flocks,<WH6629> and herds,<WH1241> and the camels,<WH1581> into two<WH8147> bands;<WH4264>
And said,<WH559> If<WH518> Esau<WH6215> come<WH935> to the one<WH259> company,<WH4264> and smite<WH5221> it, then the other company<WH4264> which is left<WH7604> shall escape.<WH6413>

And Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> O God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Abraham,<WH85> and God<WH430> of my father<WH1> Isaac,<WH3327> the LORD<WH3068> which said<WH559> to me, Return<WH7725> to your country,<WH776> and to your kindred,<WH4138> and I will deal well<WH3190> with you:

I am not worthy<WH6994> of the least<WH6994> of all<WH3605> the mercies,<WH2617> and of all<WH3605> the truth,<WH571> which<WH834> you have showed<WH6213> to your servant;<WH5650> for with my staff<WH4731> I passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> this<WH2088> Jordan;<WH3383> and now<WH6258> I am become<WH1961> two<WH8147> bands.<WH4264>

Deliver<WH5337> me, I pray<WH4994> you, from the hand<WH3027> of my brother,<WH251> from the hand<WH3027> of Esau:<WH6215> for I fear<WH3373> him, lest<WH6435> he will come<WH935> and smite<WH5221> me, and the mother<WH517> with the children.<WH1121>

And you said,<WH559> I will surely do you good,<WH3190> and make<WH7760> your seed<WH2233> as the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> which<WH834> cannot<WH3808> be numbered<WH5608> for multitude.<WH7230>
And he lodged<WH3885> there<WH8033> that same<WH1931> night;<WH3915> and took<WH3947> of that which came<WH935> to his hand<WH3027> a present<WH4503> for Esau<WH6215> his brother;<WH251>
Two hundred<WH3967> she goats,<WH5795> and twenty<WH6242> he goats,<WH8495> two hundred<WH3967> ewes,<WH7353> and twenty<WH6242> rams,<WH352>
Thirty<WH7970> milk<WH3243> camels<WH1581> with their colts,<WH1121> forty<WH705> cows,<WH6510> and ten<WH6235> bulls,<WH6499> twenty<WH6242> she asses,<WH860> and ten<WH6235> foals.<WH5895>

And he delivered<WH5414> them into the hand<WH3027> of his servants,<WH5650> every drove<WH5739> by themselves;<WH905> and said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> Pass<WH5674> over<WH5674> before<WH6440> me, and put<WH7760> a space<WH7305> between<WH996> drove<WH5739> and drove.<WH5739>

And he commanded<WH6680> the foremost,<WH7223> saying,<WH559> When<WH3588> Esau<WH6215> my brother<WH251> meets<WH6298> you, and asks<WH7592> you, saying,<WH559> Whose<WH4310> are you? and where<WH575> go<WH3212> you? and whose<WH4310> are these<WH428> before<WH6440> you?
Then you shall say,<WH559> They be your servant<WH5650> Jacob's;<WH3290> it is a present<WH4503> sent<WH7971> to my lord<WH113> Esau:<WH6215> and, behold,<WH2009> also<WH1571> he is behind<WH310> us.

And so<WH1571> commanded<WH6680> he the second,<WH8145> and the third,<WH7992> and all<WH3605> that followed<WH1980> <WH310> the droves,<WH5739> saying,<WH559> On this<WH2088> manner<WH1697> shall you speak<WH1696> to Esau,<WH6215> when you find<WH4672> him.

And say<WH559> you moreover,<WH1571> Behold,<WH2009> your servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> is behind<WH310> us. For he said,<WH559> I will appease<WH3722> <WH6440> him with the present<WH4503> that goes<WH1980> before<WH6440> me, and afterward<WH310> <WH3651> I will see<WH7200> his face;<WH6440> peradventure<WH194> he will accept<WH5375> of me.
So went<WH5674> the present<WH4503> over<WH5674> before<WH5921> <WH6440> him: and himself<WH1931> lodged<WH3885> that night<WH3915> in the company.<WH4264>

And he rose<WH6965> up that night,<WH3915> and took<WH3947> his two<WH8147> wives,<WH802> and his two<WH8147> womenservants,<WH8198> and his eleven<WH259> <WH6240> sons,<WH3206> and passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> the ford<WH4569> Jabbok.<WH2999>
And he took<WH3947> them, and sent<WH5674> them over<WH5674> the brook,<WH5158> and sent<WH5674> over<WH5674> that he had.
And Jacob<WH3290> was left<WH3498> alone;<WH905> and there wrestled<WH79> a man<WH376> with him until<WH5704> the breaking<WH5927> of the day.<WH7837>

And when he saw<WH7200> that he prevailed<WH3201> not against him, he touched<WH5060> the hollow<WH3709> of his thigh;<WH3409> and the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob's<WH3290> thigh<WH3409> was out of joint,<WH3363> as he wrestled<WH79> with him.
And he said,<WH559> Let me go,<WH7971> for the day<WH7837> breaks.<WH5927> And he said,<WH559> I will not let you go,<WH7971> except<WH3588> <WH518> you bless<WH1288> me.
And he said<WH559> to him, What<WH4100> is your name?<WH8034> And he said,<WH559> Jacob.<WH3290>

And he said,<WH559> Your name<WH8034> shall be called<WH559> no<WH3808> more<WH5750> Jacob,<WH3290> but Israel:<WH3478> for as a prince have you power<WH8280> with God<WH430> and with men,<WH582> and have prevailed.<WH3201>

And Jacob<WH3290> asked<WH7592> him, and said,<WH559> Tell<WH5046> me, I pray<WH4994> you, your name.<WH8034> And he said,<WH559> Why<WH4100> is it that you do ask<WH7592> after my name?<WH8034> And he blessed<WH1288> him there.<WH8033>
And Jacob<WH3290> called<WH7121> the name<WH8034> of the place<WH4725> Peniel:<WH6439> for I have seen<WH7200> God<WH430> face<WH6440> to face,<WH6440> and my life<WH5315> is preserved.<WH5337>
And as he passed<WH5674> over<WH5674> Penuel<WH6439> the sun<WH8121> rose<WH2224> on him, and he halted<WH6761> on his thigh.<WH3409>

Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> eat<WH398> not of the sinew<WH1517> which shrank,<WH5384> which<WH834> is on the hollow<WH3709> of the thigh,<WH3409> to this<WH2088> day:<WH3117> because<WH3588> he touched<WH5060> the hollow<WH3709> of Jacob's<WH3290> thigh<WH3409> in the sinew<WH1517> that shrank.<WH5384>
